result.execSummary:
All charges against Brett Tobin Nelson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brett Tobin Nelson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Susan T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:53 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Defendant for today. Defendant Brett Tobin Nelson appeared by video, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument. Court orders bond. NG. Reserve on pre-plea rights. Court sets STC to check status of counsel.  gll
